Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing with access to water and light.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy and is wilting without water.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy and is wilting without light.
The student can show through the drawings how plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify and label the parts of the plant in each drawing, if possible.
